data.title: What to See in Matanzas, Cuba
data.text:
Get to know the invaluable places that Matanzas hides and you will understand why it is nicknamed the Athens of Cuba

Matanzas, the capital of the Cuban province of the same name, has a lot to offer. Situated on the western tip of the island, east of Havana, it gives you the opportunity to delve into the city's interesting history, marvel at its unique architecture and landscapes, and above all, soaks up the real Cuba.

Teatro Sauto (Sauto Theatre): Get to know the Sauto Theatre in Matanzas, Cuba, its cultural importance and majestic architecture.

Puente Calixto García (Calixto García Bridge): Stop by the Calixto García Bridge in Matanzas, Cuba. Out of 21 bridges this one is the most beautiful one in the whole city.

Plaza de la Vigía (Vigía Square): Discover the Vigía Square in Matanzas, Cuba which can be considered as the city’s main point of origin and the source of astonishing monuments.

Ediciones Vigía (Ediciones Vigía Publishing Company): Swing by the Ediciones Vigía Publishing Company and be amazed by this award-winning book publishing company thanks to the high quality of its publications.

Biblioteca Gener y Del Monte (Library): Visit the Biblioteca Gener and Del Monte in Matanzas, Cuba, the old building of the Spanish Casino.

Catedral de San Carlos Borromeo (Cathedral of San Carlos Borromeo): Visit the original Catedral de Matanzas, in Cuba, and marvel at the beautiful old frescoes inside.

Archivo Histórico (Historical Archives) : Visit the Archivo Histórico of Matanzas, Cuba, an example of 19th century domestic architecture.

Palacio de Gobierno (City Hall): Tour the majestic Palacio de Gobierno in Matanzas, Cuba, one of the most beautiful buildings in the city.

Palacio de Justicia (Courthouse): Visit the Palacio de Justicia in Matanzas, Cuba, another example of the colonial city' s beauty.

Cuartel Goicuría (Goicuria Barracks): Learn about the history of the Cuartel Goicuría in Matanzas, where an important event in Cuban history took place.

Estadio Palmar de Junco (Palmar de Junco Stadium): Visit the historic Estadio Palmar de Junco in Matanzas, Cuba, the oldest active stadium in the world.

Barrio de Versalles (Versailles Neighborhood): Walk through the streets of the Barrio de Versalles in Matanzas, the origin of one of Cuba's cultural symbols, the rumba.

Parque de la Libertad (Liberty Park): Discover Parque de la Libertad, a key place in your visit to Matanzas, Cuba, and its magnificent surroundings.

Parque de Bomberos (Fire Station): Discover the Parque de Bomberos in Matanzas, Cuba, its magnificent facade and the museum it houses.

Castillo de San Severino (San Severino Castle): Discover Castillo de San Severino in Matanzas, Cuba, and the Museo de la Ruta de los Esclavos (Slave Route Museum) inside.

Iglesia de San Pedro Apóstol (Church of San Pedro Apóstol): See the Iglesia de San Pedro Apóstol in Matanzas and discover why it is one of the most beautiful churches in Cuba.

Ermita de Monserrate (Shrine of Monserrate): Visit the Ermita de Monserrate in Matanzas, Cuba, and enjoy the views of the city and the valley of Yumurí.

Puente de la Concordia (Concordia Bridge): Visit the emblematic Puente de la Concordia on your way from downtown Matanzas, Cuba, to the popular Versailles neighbourhood.

Cuevas de Bellamar (Bellamar Caves): Discover the Cuevas de Bellamar near Matanzas, Cuba, and the unique rock formations inside.

Río Canímar (Canimar River): Sail the waters of the Río Canímar east of Matanzas, Cuba, and marvel at the grandeur of its landscape.

Castillo del Morrillo (Morrillo Castle): Visit the Castillo del Morrillo in Matanzas, Cuba, located at the mouth of the Canímar River and its Memorial Museum.

Cuevas de Santa Catalina (Caves of Santa Catalina): Discover the Cuevas de Santa Catalina in the surroundings of Matanzas, Cuba, and its remarkable stalagmites.

Cuevas de Saturno (Saturn Caves): Enter the Cuevas de Saturno, in Matanzas, Cuba, and enjoy a unique and unforgettable experience.

Museo Histórico Provincial (Provincial History Museum): Discover the Museo Histórico Provincial of Matanzas, Cuba, housed in the iconic Palacio de Junco (Junco Palace).

Museo Farmaceutico (Pharmaceutical Museum): Visit the Museo Farmacéutico in Matanzas, Cuba, a truly unique gallery that will take you back in time.

Museo de Arte Provincial (Provincial Art Museum): Visit the Museo de Arte Provincial in Matanzas, Cuba, and discover its grand art collection.

Museo de la Ruta de los Esclavos (Slave Route Museum): Visit the Museo Nacional de La Ruta de los Esclavos in the Castillo de San Severino (San Severino Castle), Matanzas, Cuba.

Playa Coral: Visit Playa Coral in Matanzas, Cuba, a singular natural habitat due to its coral reefs and its peaceful environment.
